    • Enum Constant Detail

      • COSINE

        public static final InnerVectorProduct COSINE
        Calculates the dot product between two vectors A and B (res = a1*b1 + ... + an*bn). If the input vectors are L2-normalized, this corresponds to the cosine. Otherwise the result of this inner product has to be normalized as cos = res / l2norm(A)*l2norm(B) to yield the actual cosine.

      • FAST_COSINE

        public static final InnerVectorProduct FAST_COSINE
        Alternate implementation of COSINE that uses an optimized algorithm depending on whether sparse or dense vectors are compared.

        The optimized implementations should be faster, but we didn't really check that yet.

      • LESK_OVERLAP

        public static final InnerVectorProduct LESK_OVERLAP

      • MIN_OVERLAP

        public static final InnerVectorProduct MIN_OVERLAP

      • LANGUAGE_MODEL

        public static final InnerVectorProduct LANGUAGE_MODEL

      • COVERAGE

        public static final InnerVectorProduct COVERAGE

      • AVERAGE_PRODUCT

        public static final InnerVectorProduct AVERAGE_PRODUCT

      • LEFT_DICE

        public static final InnerVectorProduct LEFT_DICE
        Modified Dice's coefficient that can be used to compare two sets A and B when one is interested that A is a subset of B, but B may be significantly larger than A. As for DICE, the sets can be crisp or fuzzy and are expected to be represented as vectors only consisting of non-negative elements.

        Range: 0.0 - 1.0

        See Also:
        DICE

      • DICE

        public static final InnerVectorProduct DICE
        Dice's coefficient. Calculates the similarity between two sets based on the size of the intersection compared to the sizes of the two sets. The two sets are represented as vectors. If the vectors elements only assume the values 0 or 1, the implementation calculates the actual Dice's coefficient. If the vector elements are non-negative values (best between 0 and 1), the vector is assumed to represent a fuzzy set where each vector element is the degree of membership. Vector elements must not be negative.

        Range: 0.0 - 1.0

        See Also:
        Dice's coefficient (Wikipedia), Fuzzy sets (Wikipedia)
